com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer

Class SteeringBehavior<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.ai.steer.SteeringBehavior<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of vector, either 2D or 3D, implementing the Vector interface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Arrive, BlendedSteering, FollowFlowField, GroupBehavior, MatchVelocity, PrioritySteering, Pursue, RaycastObstacleAvoidance, ReachOrientation, Seek

    public abstract class SteeringBehavior<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    A SteeringBehavior calculates the linear and/or angular accelerations to be applied to its owner.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean enabled
      A flag indicating whether this steering behavior is enabled or not.
      protected Limiter limiter
      The limiter of this steering behavior
      protected Steerable<T> owner
      The owner of this steering behavior

      Creates a SteeringBehavior for the specified owner and limiter.
      SteeringBehavior(Steerable<T> owner, Limiter limiter, boolean enabled)
      Creates a SteeringBehavior for the specified owner, limiter and activation flag.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SteeringBehavior

        public SteeringBehavior(Steerable<T> owner)
        Creates a SteeringBehavior for the specified owner. The behavior is enabled and has no explicit limiter, meaning that the owner is used instead.
        Parameters:
        owner - the owner of this steering behavior

      • SteeringBehavior

        public SteeringBehavior(Steerable<T> owner,
                        Limiter limiter)
        Creates a SteeringBehavior for the specified owner and limiter. The behavior is enabled.
        Parameters:
        owner - the owner of this steering behavior
        limiter - the limiter of this steering behavior

      • SteeringBehavior

        public SteeringBehavior(Steerable<T> owner,
                        boolean enabled)
        Creates a SteeringBehavior for the specified owner and activation flag. The behavior has no explicit limiter, meaning that the owner is used instead.
        Parameters:
        owner - the owner of this steering behavior
        enabled - a flag indicating whether this steering behavior is enabled or not

      • SteeringBehavior

        public SteeringBehavior(Steerable<T> owner,
                        Limiter limiter,
                        boolean enabled)
        Creates a SteeringBehavior for the specified owner, limiter and activation flag.
        Parameters:
        owner - the owner of this steering behavior
        limiter - the limiter of this steering behavior
        enabled - a flag indicating whether this steering behavior is enabled or not

    • Method Detail

      • calculateSteering

        public SteeringAcceleration<T> calculateSteering(SteeringAcceleration<T> steering)
        If this behavior is enabled calculates the steering acceleration and writes it to the given steering output. If it is disabled the steering output is set to zero.
        Parameters:
        steering - the steering acceleration to be calculated.
        Returns:
        the calculated steering acceleration for chaining.

      • calculateRealSteering

        protected abstract SteeringAcceleration<T> calculateRealSteering(SteeringAcceleration<T> steering)
        Calculates the steering acceleration produced by this behavior and writes it to the given steering output.

        This method is called by calculateSteering(SteeringAcceleration) when this steering behavior is enabled.

        Parameters:
        steering - the steering acceleration to be calculated.
        Returns:
        the calculated steering acceleration for chaining.

      • getOwner

        public Steerable<T> getOwner()
        Returns the owner of this steering behavior.

      • setOwner

        public SteeringBehavior<T> setOwner(Steerable<T> owner)
        Sets the owner of this steering behavior.
        Returns:
        this behavior for chaining.

      • getLimiter

        public Limiter getLimiter()
        Returns the limiter of this steering behavior.

      • setLimiter

        public SteeringBehavior<T> setLimiter(Limiter limiter)
        Sets the limiter of this steering behavior.
        Returns:
        this behavior for chaining.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns true if this steering behavior is enabled; false otherwise.

      • setEnabled

        public SteeringBehavior<T> setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets this steering behavior on/off.
        Returns:
        this behavior for chaining.

      • getActualLimiter

        protected Limiter getActualLimiter()
        Returns the actual limiter of this steering behavior.

      • newVector

        protected T newVector(Location<T> location)
        Utility method that creates a new vector.

        This method is used internally to instantiate vectors of the correct type parameter T. This technique keeps the API simple and makes the API easier to use with the GWT backend because avoids the use of reflection.

        Parameters:
        location - the location whose position is used to create the new vector
        Returns:
        the newly created vector
